Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: MikeKaz55
Reviews.Content: Wonderful business stay with all the conveniences of fully equipped apartment. I will be returning in the spring with my wife. The location is excellent , staff is very helpful, and the layout of the flat was very chic. Istanbul is a phenomenal place to visit. - very romantic!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Aparthotel, excellent location near Taxim square”
Reviews.Author: Bazza0070
Reviews.Content: Great Aparthotel, I had a Mikado suite and the suite was exactly like the pictures on the website. Free Wifi throughout the hotel. The location is on a main road 100 meters from Taxim square which is busy all night long but because the bedroom was divided from the rest of the apartment, I did not have any excess noise. I had a kitchenette but not inclined to use it as a great variety of restaurants nearby although the fridge was handy. Staff were all very friendly. Hotel very clean. Breakfast was very good, served in the restaurant downstairs (which I think was called Faros?) This restaurant is also very good for lunch / evening meals, and you get 10% discount for staying at Taxim Suite Hotel. It's a short walk to Taxim square, Besiktas football stadium, and the boats across to Asia. Best advice I can give, when you arrive at either Ataturk or Sabiha Gokcen airports, there is a shuttle bus to Taxim square that is right outside Airport arrivals, cost me 12 Turkish Lira from Sabiha (around Â£4) and the taxim square stop is 50 meters from apartment. The return goes from the same place every half hour and takes between 1 hr and 1 hr and a half to get to Sabiha Gokcen. I also had a taxi do the same journey for 120 TL (around Â£40) and did not feel as safe.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing aparthotel, warm staff and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Patricia_in_Bromley
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights in Istanbul on holiday last week at this aparthotel and had a great time. As another reviewer said the only difficulty was leaving the apartment each day! I had a 5th floor Miyako suite and really liked the layout and practicality of the fittings. The spa bath was a strong pulse and very nice on aching soles after a day pounding the pavement. The bed is really comfortable, the wake up alarm on time and nicely spoken. The staff really try hard to make sure you are happy. The aircon was operating but not cooling the room when I moved in, and they sent a technician in within 30 mins (it was after 9pm) and it was working by 10pm. I really am impressed by this approach. The breakfast was in the Faros restaurant downstairs, and was a hot and cold buffet with serve yourself filter coffee included. Excellent fruit and cheese, meat and pastries offered. I didnt eat for hours afterwards. It is available from 7.30 to 11am. Incidentally they offer the Turkish breakfast at a cost of 17TL on their menu, so it is always refreshed and looking good. I can find nothing lacking, the location is superb the staff are helpful, and the accommodation excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but good about this aparthotel”
Reviews.Author: Mianel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip in June 2011 for 6 days. This is an all aparthotel with about 25 apartments I guess. For the price of a 3 star hotel you have a five star apartment!! And a lot more space. I felt very much at home after a long working day. Just look at their excellent website, which shows you exactly how it is. They show a floor plan of each apartment type. The apartments are spacious (living room, bedroom, kitchen, bathroom) and nicely modern decorated, a bit Scandinavian style I would say. Free Wifi that worked fine and a good desk to work. I stayed in an Avenue apartment at the 6th floor. I even had a view on the Bosporus! I also saw a Park apartment as a friend of us stayed there and this was also very good. The hotel is located at a very busy road, but this didnâ€™t bother me (it is busy everywhere in Istanbul). The location is perfect: close to the Taxim Square and a 10 minutesâ€™ walk to the Convention centre. Lots and lots of restaurants in the neighborhood. Be sure that you have the address with you as our taxi driver didnâ€™t know it when we came from the airport, and although there is a sign on the roof of the hotel, the entrance is difficult to recognize. The hotel desk is manned 24 hours a day and the staff were always friendly. Breakfast was included in our apartment price and was served in the restaurant next door (with a very nice terrace for the morning coffee).

Reviews.Title: “Jewel in the crown.”
Reviews.Author: erdalito
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to this hotel last two years. This time I have resided more than 6 weeks. My room had a beautiful view of the Bosphorous and the Taksim Park. The staff starting with the manager Zeynep, top down most friendly and helpful people one can wish in a hotel in a foreign country. This is an all suite hotel, extremely comfortable, with all the amenities one needs. My living room was furnished beautifully, airy and bright rooms. I truely felt at home. One had all the comforts of home. With one word I would describe this hotel as Jewel in the Crown. Can recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “A rip off”
Reviews.Author: gillparry
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to staying at Taxim suites for four nights in May. Very, very disappointed... 1. We had Â£50 stolen from the 'safe box' in the room, with little concern shown by the manager. It turns out there is an 'over-ride code' which clearly staff at the suites must have access to ... We couldn't get into the safe using the code we had punched in the night before, and when the manager opened it for us a Â£50 note was missing. 2. The airport transfer we requested was not arranged so we had to take the bus instead 3. The suites are advertised as all having a jacuzzi. In fact our suite had a bath and a very weak drizzle of a shower 4. The rooms are quite nice though rather worn now, with stains on the rug in the sitting room etc 5. It is very noisy 6. The towels are not 'pristinely' clean, which is a little worrying. All in all, these suites are advertised as highest quality - at 160 euros per night self catering that could certainly be expected. But we thought they were over priced, not great value and not secure. The theft of the money from the room's safe box left a very nasty taste in the mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms & close to the where all the action takes place”
Reviews.Author: KalordT
Reviews.Content: First off the rooms, look exactly like they do on the website photos. Leaving you feelign like a King Secondly, it is close to the epicenter of Istanbul - namely Taksim Sq, and about 7 mins walk from Kabatas (for the Bosphorus ferries) and the main pedestrianised shopping street The lady running the hotel, went out of her way to make us feel welcome and was very helpful in answering any questions we had. All in all, a very positive experience - i cannot fault this hotel

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jac27
Reviews.Content: 1. When I entered my suite I was astonished, it had everything I needed, and more: it was big, modern, fresh, excellently equipped. The only problem I had was that I did not want to leave the room. 2. The stuff is very helpful, they could explain to me for hours how I could go to the places I wanted to visit or where I could find what I want. Especially the hotel's manager, Zeynep, has been VERY helpful and friendly. Also there was nothing "fake" in their behavior. You would not feel a tourist, but their friend. 3. The location is excellent, just a few metres from taksim square and Istiklal street. 4. The price is very reasonable. I have the best memories, I will definitely go there again, and I have already recommended this hotel to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location - wonderful modern aesthetic”
Reviews.Author: citygirl980
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fabulous location minutes from Taxim Square. I stayed in the Mikho suite, which was spacious and tastefully decorated. The design is modern which is difficult to find in Turkey! The front desk staff was helpful and spoke English very well. Breakfast is and it is delivered to your room - all you need to do is call down to reception and within 10 minutes it is at your door complete with fresh orange juice. The entrance to the hotel is difficult to find as there is no sign. If you take the bus from the airport (10 lire) to Taxim square, it drops you off directly across the street in front of the hotel. Look for the Point Hotel sign, Taxim Suites is just to the left.

Reviews.Title: “Best Suite Hotel I ever stayed in my whole travel experience.”
Reviews.Author: erdalito
Reviews.Content: This beautiful Boutique Hotel has an incredible location, right in the center of Istanbul. The one bedroom suite I had was beautifully furnished and I felt very comfortable and safe. I had an incredible view over looking Bosphorous and beautiful tree tops. Also, my room faced to one of the major parks in Istanbul. Had a flat tv with 100's of channels and high speed interned worked flawless. The staff was courteous, attentive and they made me feel very special. Worked out in the gym, in the basement when I had a free time. This hotel has the best location in Istanbul. Very easy to access all over the city from this location. There are plenty of eateries nearby and a major shopping and entertainment district is 5 minutes walk from the hotel. I can recommend this hotel to anyone planning to travel to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: jaygordon
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is the most exciting city in the world for me, and I have visited many times in more than 20 years. When I decided to spend a month, I asked a Turkish friend to recommend a suitable hotel. This is the only one he mentioned, and I was quickly reassured as I settled in. My sprawling suite overlooked a lovely park setting with a view of the Bosphorus in the distance. (Just past a couple of upscale chain hotels costing at least twice as much.) Yet, I was steps away from a public transportation hub and countless restaurants, shops, bakeries, etc. This area is teeming with Turks going about their daily lives, so you actually feel like you're THERE. No disrespect to the tourist areas such as around the Egyptian Spice Bazaar and the Sultanahmet District (a short taxi ride or vigorous, scenic walk away), but the Turks themselves are a main attraction. They are hospitable and kind. Look helpless for a moment, and someone will offer assistance. The bus from the airport (much less expensive than a taxi) stops just up the street on the other side. The daily breakfast cheerfully served in your room is an introduction to local food and a great way to start your day. The kitchen is equipped with mico, 'fridge, electric kettle, etc. Great food shopping is a block away. There's even a CD player. Mostly, I appreciated the sense of space. A corner suite on an upper floor, if available, provides an especially bright, cheerful living area. My bedroom had walk-in closets and a TV (in addition to the one in the living room.) Watch re-runs of old American TV shows! The decor is modern and functional. This is a relatively small hotel for such a large metropolitan city, and there may be times when communication with room service staff, for example, will be primarily by gestures and body language. The front desk personnel, however, speak English well and are extremely eager to please. The sales director, Zeynep Siseci, sometimes works at the front desk and can also be called for assistance. She speaks exquisite English and is a superb source of information to help guests. The free Internet connection is the fastest I've seen. I had a daily video cam session with my sweetie back home and it was like being in the same room. (WAY better image quality than I get at home!) Free self-service laundry. (Buy soap at nearby grocery.) Professional laundry/dry cleaning available. Perhaps five minutes away is the famed Istiklal Cadessi, a thrilling pedestrian promenade where -- at nearly any hour of the day or night -- thousands of locals and visitors stroll among a dizzying array of shops, restaurants, and entertainment. Even if you don't speak a word of Turkish you can dine inexpensively by simply pointing at what you want to eat in countless buffets! Impressive cuisine; reasonable prices. This is a metropolitan area, so don't expect quiet. (Take ear plugs if some city noise bothers you.) Learn a few words of Turkish to enhance your travel experience. Your effort will be appreciated. Express appreciation for things you enjoy. Smile a lot!

Reviews.Title: “I am in love with Taxim Suites.”
Reviews.Author: dzeni
Reviews.Content: How in love? So in love that I will be booking many weeks in this hotel in 2009, as I am here on business. So in love, that I won't tell too many other colleagues about it, until I have secured my reservation, for fear I won't get a room. The hotel has a great location, near cafes, a park, surrounded by restaurants and shopping, and a 5 minute walk to Istiklal, the great walking/dining/shopping street in Beyoglu. The noise level is definately urban, but tolerable. If you have stayed in New York City, you will have no problem with the traffic sounds, pedestrian chatter. The suites are cozy, clean, modern, and stylish. As a business traveler, I have plenty of room to work, relax, and keep a fridge stocked for those nights/days I can't get out to dine with colleagues. It is a relief at the end of a long day to walk in, drop my bag and keys, grab something from the fridge, kick off my shoes and relax in my "living room". And just like home, I have a DVD Player, a couple of TVs and plenty of storage space. The staff is attentive and helpful- and wake-up calls (the non-automated kind) are timely to the minute. Breakfast is delivered daily to your room; the wireless is fast and free; and the laundry is on-sight and also free. They will even do your grocery shopping for you, with a modest 10% charge. Downsides? Not many- I tell my colleagues the only thing I am giving up is room service, and a pool. So if either of those is important to you, you could chose a Hilton. If you like cozy, comfortable, and local - this is the place for you!!

HotelInfo.Name: Taxim Suites
HotelInfo.Address: Cumuriyet cad. No 31 | Taksim, Istanbul 34437, Turkey
